dcterms:description: A synthetic dataset used to evaluate the performance of the proposed algorithms in a two-dimensional network setting for sleep-wake scheduling in wireless sensor networks.
dcterms:title: Synthetic 2-dimensional network setting

dcterms:creator: J.A. Fuemmeler
V.V. Veeravalli
dcterms:description: The QMDP algorithm is used as a benchmark for comparison with the proposed algorithms in the context of sleep-wake scheduling in sensor networks.
dcterms:title: QMDP algorithm

dcterms:creator: J.A. Fuemmeler
G.K. Atia
V.V. Veeravalli
dcterms:description: The FCR algorithm is referenced as a comparison point for the proposed algorithms in the paper, focusing on sleep control for tracking in sensor networks.
dcterms:title: FCR algorithm

dcterms:description: A procedure for estimating the mobility model of the intruder, which is integrated into the proposed algorithms to enhance performance in scenarios where the mobility model is unknown.
dcterms:title: Mobility model estimation procedure

dcterms:description: Reinforcement learning algorithms including Q-learning, TQSA-A, and TQSA-D are discussed in the context of their application to sleep-wake scheduling in sensor networks.
dcterms:title: Reinforcement learning algorithms (Q-learning, TQSA-A, TQSA-D)

dcterms:description: Various algorithms for sleep-wake scheduling are mentioned as part of the comparative analysis in the paper, focusing on their effectiveness in sensor networks.
dcterms:title: Various algorithms for sleep-wake scheduling
